The source of the claim: The expert identified that the claim originated from a disreputable website called The Boston Tribune, which has a history of publishing hoax stories.
Lack of evidence in official records: The expert pointed out that there was no record of President Obama signing an executive order numbered 13749 or any executive order related to banning fake news outlets.
Inconsistencies in the story: The expert highlighted that the claim mentioned the alleged executive order being signed in response to a fake news article from a different website, which raised doubts about the authenticity of the claim itself.
Reputation of the website: The expert mentioned that The Boston Tribune has a history of publishing baseless and false claims, further undermining the credibility of the claim.
